Text: My my captain...  Look at the beauty you've got us, New Colony surely knows how to build a ship.
Mr. Voss! I'm glad you arrived, I was worried you would put down my offer. Must say that new uniform also suits you better than our old Merchant Alliance rags.

Once a sailor always a sailor, Captain, and I'm too old to retire. This Horizon Star... This ship is something else. Where does a corporation from a far-away colony get all this advanced technology from?
We have been traveling at light-speed for centuries in earth time, Voss. I guess that old ship we used to flight is now considered a relic, the kind that belongs in a museum.
Indeed captain, four hundred and seventy two years have passed for earth since you left. That is remarkable, even for a Merchant Alliance ship.
The civilian crew is not ready yet, may I propose that we take this beauty out for a spin?

Choices.Text: Let's focus on embarking them as soon as possible.
